pageContext.claim: “I mean, [the crisis on the Korean peninsula] has been going on for 75 years -- now let's say 25 years with the missiles and the nuclear -- but no president's done anything.”
pageContext.analysis: All three presidents tried to deal with North Korea. Bill Clinton negotiated a nuclear agreement with North Korea that froze its plutonium program and was working on a missile deal. But that agreement fell apart under George W. Bush. But then Bush tried to negotiate a deal, even lifting sanctions on North Korea. But those tentative agreements fell apart as well and Obama was unable to make much more progress.
